Introducing RevelsMD

RevelsMD (REduced Variance Estimators of the Local Strucure in MD simulations) is a python package which allows for the calculatation of reduced variance radial distribution and 3 dimensional densities using a family of force sampling methods. The code can process a variety of different software outputs (lammps, vasp, mdanalaysis) as well as being able to be interfaced with directly using trajectory information loaded into numpy arrays.

RevelsMD was developed over 5 years at Sorbonne Université and the University of Bath. This code is the culmination of many years of statistical mechanical and computational chemical development. A small history of this is provided in the History of force sampling methods section,as well as in this 2020 review

Check out the Usage section for further information, including how to Installation the project.
